ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
cdt_name:
- cos6
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-cos7-x86_64

about.description:
Deep-learning-based approach for identification of eukaryotic sequences in the metagenomic data powered by PyTorch.
The sequences are classified in two stages:
In the first stage, the sequences are classified to classes: archaea, bacteria, prokarya, eukarya, organelle and unknown. In the second stage, the sequences labeled as organelle in the first stage are classified to either mitochondria, plastid or unknown.
For more information, please refer to our paper: Tiara: Deep learning-based classification system for eukaryotic sequences. (DOI: https://doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btab672)
about.summary: Deep-learning-based approach for identification of eukaryotic sequences in the metagenomic data.

about.description:
Deep-learning-based approach for identification of eukaryotic sequences in the metagenomic data powered by PyTorch.
The sequences are classified in two stages:
In the first stage, the sequences are classified to classes: archaea, bacteria, prokarya, eukarya, organelle and unknown. In the second stage, the sequences labeled as organelle in the first stage are classified to either mitochondria, plastid or unknown.
For more information, please refer to our paper: Tiara: Deep learning-based classification system for eukaryotic sequences. (DOI: https://doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btab672)
about.summary: Deep-learning-based approach for identification of eukaryotic sequences in the metagenomic data.

name: tiara
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "tiara" %}
{% set version = "1.0.3" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/tiara-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 77585ae73a019dc73d7f0397082685a662c07ab15bdba7ee18c1cda41738ad76

build:
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv
  number: 0

requirements:
  host:
    - python >=3.7,<=3.9
    - pip
  run:
    - python >=3.7,<=3.9
    - biopython >=1.78,<2.dev0
    - joblib >=0.17.0,<0.18.dev0
    - numba >=0.52.0rc3,<0.53.0rc1.post1
    - numpy >=1.19.4,<1.20.dev0
    - skorch >=0.9.0,<0.10.dev0
    - pytorch >=1.7.0,<1.8.dev0
    - tqdm >=4.54.0,<4.55.dev0

test:
  imports:
    - tiara
  commands:
    - pip check
    - tiara --help
  requires:
    - pip

about:
  home: https://ibe-uw.github.io/tiara/
  summary: Deep-learning-based approach for identification of eukaryotic sequences in the metagenomic data.
  description: "Deep-learning-based approach for identification of eukaryotic sequences in the metagenomic data powered by PyTorch.

  The sequences are classified in two stages:

  In the first stage, the sequences are classified to classes: archaea, bacteria, prokarya, eukarya, organelle and unknown.
  In the second stage, the sequences labeled as organelle in the first stage are classified to either mitochondria, plastid or unknown.

  For more information, please refer to our paper:
    Tiara: Deep learning-based classification system for eukaryotic sequences. 
    (DOI: https://doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btab672)"
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  doc_url: https://ibe-uw.github.io/tiara/
  dev_url: https://github.com/ibe-uw/tiara

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - santonow
